Subject: web archiving project
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=241416423

Sorry if this is an abuse of this mailing list but it seemed the best way 
to get this out to developers who have experience with heritrix and might 
be interested in this.

We have an open position for a java developer to work on a web archiving 
project. This would entail co-designing and co-developing (with me) an 
infrastructure using existing open-source software like heritrix and 
nutchwax, but also developing new software for processing, cataloging, 
visualizing, delivery and integration with our digital preservation repository.

I believe that this job posting will be closed sometime next week. We've 
had some applicants but no one yet already familiar with web archiving. 
Here's the official description:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
The Library Digital Initiative program of the Harvard University Library 
has funded a multi year project to develop a curated web site archiving 
solution.  We seek a Java software developer to work in a 2 person software 
team to develop the system and explore the capture and preservation issues 
surrounding this initiative. We'll be working closely with archivists and 
academic staff to define harvesting, preservation and discovery 
requirements and build easy to use software tools for capturing diverse web 
sites that include women's blogs, web sites related to the constitutional 
revision process in Japan, and web sites for Harvard departments. Over a 
two year period, we will build a robust, extensible solution integrated 
with the Harvard Digital Repository Service.

If interested in pursuing this exciting project, see the Harvard University 
job listing site, 
<http://www.employment.harvard.edu/>http://www.employment.harvard.edu/, and 
search for job requisition number 25878. For more information, feel free to 
contact me.

Randy Stern
Harvard University Library Office for Information Systems
Manager of Systems Development
email: <mailto:randy_stern@...>randy_stern@...
phone: 617-495-3724
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

thanks,
Andrea
